Generic.description: Generic domain contains type definitions used in other domains.

URL.description: URL Record, as defined by WHATWG URL Standard.

Cookie.description: An object which defines a cookie. For more information on the fields of this object, see RFC 6265 section 5.2.

url.description: The URL from which the cookie is set.

expires.description: Expiration date in seconds since the epoch (January 1, 1970 UTC).

Account.description:
Account information for filling in contact details.
Receipts and booking references will typically be sent to specified email.
Some websites also require registering user account, in which case password must be provided.

email.description:
Account email, typically used for user sign up / sign in, as well as contact information.
Note: most websites will send receipt and/or confirmation emails when order is placed successfully.
Automation may result in registering new user account with this email address, and may fail if account with specified email already exists. We recommend you use an email proxy to mitigate this issue.

password.description: May be omitted if particular website does not require user sign in / sign up. Automation may fail if password is required on a particular website but not provided. One strategy could be to always generate random passwords to create one-time account.

phone.description: Account phone number, may also be used as contact details.

isExisting.description: If value is true automation will try to use account details to perform sign in instead of sign up. Automation will fail if incorrect account details are specified.

firstName.description: First name(s) or given name(s), as specified in ID.

middleName.description:
Middle name, if applicable.
This will only be used on websites which provide separate entry for middle names, otherwise it will be ignored.
If middle name is essential for placing order, consider appending it to firstName.

lastName.description: Last name or surname, as specified in ID.

Address.description: Physical address information, typically used as part of billing or shipping address objects.

city.description: Name of city, town or other settlement.

postcode.description: Postcode in country-specific format, e.g. 5-digit number in US or E3 3RP in UK.

Phone.description: Phone information, typically used on contact details pages.

number.description: Mobile phone number (numbers only, excluding country code).

PriceConsent.description:
Price consent object used in final price confirmation flow.
When automation reaches final price (typically happens immediately before placing the order) it will emit finalPrice object in output and will wait for consent from you. You then need to provide the exact copy of this object as finalPriceConsent input.

value.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (100 for Â£1.00).

Payment.description: Payment information, including card details and billing address.

PaymentCard.description: Payment information for card payment. Note: card number should not be submitted in plain text as per PCI DSS. Use panToken to provide it securely instead.

brand.description: Card brand, must be one of the supported card brands. Automation may fail if a specific card brand is not supported on a particular website.

expirationDate.description: Expiration date in YYYY-MM format as written on card.

name.description: Cardholder's name as written on card.

cvv.description: Security code written on card, 3- or 4-digit number.

PanToken.description: An encrypted PAN token, obtained from Automation Cloud Vault. Please consult "Vaulting Payment Card Information" section of Documentation for information on how to acquire it.

CountryCode.title: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 Country Code
CountryCode.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code representing the country. United Kingdom is officially assigned the alpha-2 code gb rather than uk. Lowercase.

CountrySubdivision.description: Full name of country subdivision (e.g. state, region, county, etc.), except for US states which require 2 letter code. Lowercased.

CurrencyCode.title: ISO 4217 Currency Code
CurrencyCode.description: ISO 4217 3-letter code representing the currency. Lowercase.

errors.description: Job cancelled by client
Input was not provided within 15 minutes
Payment rejected due to a problem with the card. A message will be forwarded from the website if provided.
Unable to process payment as card details are invalid
Invalid address provided
Cannot sign in as invalid account details provided
Invalid url provided
Final price provided does not match expectation
Invalid pan token provided
Invalid cookie provided
Price changed after final price consent.
Website's validation rule doesn't allow the input data
Website system is down/Website doesn't work at the moment
Cannot process due to known limitation
Website threw general error during automation process. A message will be forwarded from the website if provided.
Process couldn't reach the final step. Website finished the process early
Server Error
Job timeout after an hour of job creation without reaching the final step

FlightBooking.description: Allows automating airplane tickets booking on airline websites and OTAs.

url.description: Website entry point. Should be a deep link to either flight page or flight selection page.

selectedOutboundFare.description:
Requested when fare selection for outbound flight is required by website.
At this point availableOutboundFares output should contain information about available fares.
Note: on deep links with pre-selected flight this input is not required.
Automation may fail if incorrect fare is specified, or if fare is no longer available.

selectedInboundFare.description:
Requested when fare selection for inbound flight is required by website.
At this point availableInboundFares output should contain information about available fares.
Note: on deep links with pre-selected flight this input is not required.
Automation may fail if incorrect fare is specified, or if fare is no longer available.

finalPriceConsent.description:
Client's consent for final price, should exactly match the finalPrice object from output.
Automation will not proceed with placing order until the consent is provided.

availableOutboundFares.description:
Emitted when actual outbound fares information is collected.
Note: on deep links with pre-selected flight this output will not be provided.

availableInboundFares.description:
Emitted when actual inbound fares information is collected.
Note: on deep links with pre-selected flight this output will not be provided.

finalPrice.description:
Emitted immediately before placing order, when final price is available.
Automation will request finalPriceConsent input which should match this object.

Options.description: Flags for enabling optional automation features like seat selection. Clients should send false or omit flags if specific features are not implemented on their end.

seatSelection.description: If true, automation will request selectedSeats for seat selection.

Itinerary.description: Information about flights and cabin class preference.

cabinClass.description: Preferred cabin class, used on flight search forms.

inbound.description: Inbound (return) flight specification. If omitted, one-way flight booking flow is used.

dateTime.description: Date and time of flight (airport local time).

airportCode.description: International Air Transport Association airport code.

Passengers.description: An array with details for each passenger.

firstName.description: First name(s) or given name(s), as specified in passport or travel document.

middleName.description:
Middle name, if applicable.
This will only be used on websites which provide separate entry for middle names, otherwise it will be ignored.
If middle name is essential for placing order, consider appending it to firstName.

lastName.description: Last name or surname, as specified in passport or travel document.

dateOfBirth.description: Passenger's date of birth in YYYY-MM-DD format.

PassengerDocument.description: Passenger ID (passport or other travel document). Automation may fail if this information is required by website, but not provided by Client.

issueCountryCode.description: Code of country where the document was issued.

AvailableFares.description: A list of available fares found on the website.

fareName.description: Fare marketing name as provided by airline.

SelectedSeatsStage.description: Seat selection stage. Each stage corresponds to a particular flight leg where seat selection is supported. Client provides each stage separately after reading corresponding seat availability information from availableSeats output.

seatNumbers.description:
An array of seatNumber selected per each passenger.
Order must match the order of passengers array.

AvailableSeatsStage.description: Seat availability information for each seat selection stage. Each stage corresponds to a particular flight leg where seat selection is supported. Each stage is emitted separately when automation reaches corresponding seat selection screen.

leg.description: Flight leg name as displayed on website.

SeatNumber.description: Seat number as extracted from website.

available.description: true if website allows selecting this seat, false otherwise.

restricted.description: true if seat has restrictions for certain groups of passengers.

price.description: Seat price, if such information is available.

bookingReference.description: Booking reference grabbed from the page.

price.description: Price, if found on the successful booking page.

errors.description: Passenger details invalid
Outbound flight date is not accepted by the website
Inbound flight date is not accepted by the website
Date of birth is not accepted by the website
Document issue date is not accepted by the website
errors.example: The issue date cannot be after today's date

errors.description: Document expiration date is not accepted by the website
errors.example: Document should be valid for more than 3 months

errors.description: Outbound flight is not found
errors.example: Flight is not available on given date

errors.description: Inbound flight is not found
errors.example: Flight is not available on given date

errors.description: Flight not combinable
Airport is not found with given airport code
Airport is not found with given airport code
Given cabin class is not found on the website
Given outbound fare does not match one of the options we are expecting
Given inbound fare does not match one of the options we are expecting
Given seat does not match one of the options we are expecting
Client asked for seat selection but it's not available for the website
Luggage cannot be added
Passenger document (passport or other travel document) is required by the website

finalPriceConsent.description:
Client's consent for final price, should exactly match the finalPrice object from output.
Automation will not proceed with placing order until the consent is provided.

finalPrice.description:
Emitted immediately before placing order, when final price is available.
Automation will request finalPriceConsent input which should match this object.

availableDeposits.description:
Emitted when actual deposit information is collected.
Note: on deep links with pre-selected deposits this output may not be provided.

Options.description: Flags for enabling optional automation features.

AvailableDeposits.description: A list of available deposits found on the page.

name.description: Deposit prompt as provided by the website.

total.description: Total count of pets for the booking, including dogs.

dogs.description: Total count of dogs for the booking.

bookingReference.description: Booking reference grabbed from the page.

price.description: Price, if found on the successful booking page.

errors.description: Given deposit option does not match one of the options we are expecting
Given pet option does not match one of the options we are expecting
Pet option is not available
Guest age is not accepted by the website
Vacation rental is not found
errors.example: Vacation rental unavailable on given date provided

finalPriceConsent.description:
Client's consent for final price, should exactly match the finalPrice object from output.
Automation will not proceed with placing order until the consent is provided.

finalPrice.description:
Emitted immediately before placing order, when final price is available.
Automation will request finalPriceConsent input which should match this object.

estimatedPrice.description:
Emitted before asking for payment information.
This is usually not the final amount to be paid, especially on websites which charge credit and company cards additionally. You will get finalPrice later.

availableLegalCovers.description:
Emitted when actual cover information is collected.
Note: on deep links with pre-selected additional cover this output may not be provided.

availableBreakdownCovers.description:
Emitted when actual cover information is collected.
Note: on deep links with pre-selected additional cover this output may not be provided.

availablePersonalInjuryCovers.description:
Emitted when actual cover information is collected.
Note: on deep links with pre-selected additional cover this output may not be provided.

availableCarHireCovers.description:
Emitted when actual cover information is collected.
Note: on deep links with pre-selected additional cover this output may not be provided.

purchaseReference.description: Reference code grabbed from the page.

message.example: Thank you for using UBIO Insurance. Your quote is ABC123 and purchase reference is DEF456.

price.description: Price, if found on the confirmation page.

Vehicle.description: Information about the vehicle being insured.

Options.description: Flags for enabling optional automation features such as upsells and additional cover. Clients should send false or omit flags if specific features are not implemented on their end.

AvailableCovers.description: A list of available cover options found on the page.

name.description: Cover marketing name as provided by the insurer.

errors.description: Given legal cover does not match one of the options we are expecting
Given breakdown cover does not match one of the options we are expecting
Given personal injury cover does not match one of the options we are expecting
Given car hire cover does not match one of the options we are expecting
Registration number is not accepted by the website
Registration number is required by the website

finalPriceConsent.description:
Client's consent for final price, should exactly match the finalPrice object from output.
Automation will not proceed with placing order until the consent is provided.

selectedDelivery.description:
Requested when delivery choices are required by website.
At this point availableDeliveries output should contain information about available delivery options.
Note: on deep links with pre-selected delivery options, this input might not required.
Automation may fail if the incorrect option is specified, or if the delivery option is no longer available, for example, for a late or same day booking.

finalPrice.description:
Emitted immediately before placing order, when final price is available.
Automation will request finalPriceConsent input which should match this object.

availableDeliveries.description:
Emitted when actual delivery information is collected.
Note: on deep links with pre-selected delivery, this output may not be provided.

availableRefunds.description:
Emitted when actual refund information is collected.
Note: on deep links with pre-selected refund this output may not be provided.

bookingReference.description: Booking reference grabbed from the page.

price.description: Price, if found on the successful booking page.

name.description: Delivery text as provided by the insurer.
name.example: Collection from venue, Royal Mail post, Courier delivery

Options.description: Flags for enabling optional automation features such as upsells and additional features. Clients should send false or omit flags if specific features are not implemented on their end.

AvailableDeliveries.description: A list of available delivery options found on the page.

AvailableRefunds.description: A list of available refund options found on the page.

name.description: Refund marketing text as provided by the insurer.

errors.description: Delivery option does not match one of the options we are expecting
Refund option does not match one of the options we are expecting
Requested event is not found

Internal.description: Internal domain for testing platform features.

errors.description: Internal error occurred
Client caused error
